H0.text: Sitting at a desk is an example of work, because work is defined as the product of force and distance.

H1.text: Pushing on a wall is an example of work, which is the product of force and distance.

H2.text: Riding a bike is an example of work, which is a product of force and distance.

H3.text: Reading a book is an example of work, since work is a product of force and distance.

A4.text: integrating with respect to position gives a definition for the work done by a force: W = ∫ F ⋅ dx

A5.text: the work done by a force: W = ∫ F ⋅ dx, which is equivalent to changes in kinetic energy (yielding the work energy theorem)
